result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A. Kaepernick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Armed w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Shall undergo and follow through with domestic violence counseling as directed by agent;  Shall undergo anger management counseling and follow through as directed;  Shall undergo and follow through with any other counseling as directed by agent

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

8/10/16: THE COURT WILL ALLOW CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM IN A LEGAL SETTING WITH AN ATTORNEY PRESENT OR IN A COURTROOM SETTING. THE COURT WILL ALLOW PHONE CONTACT AND WILL ALLOW CONTACT IN A THERAPEUTIC SETTING IN COUNSELING HE'S ENGAGED IN OR THEY ARE ENGAGED IN.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt: 15CF30 - Defendant, Charles A. Kaepernick in court,  Mary Wendel and Jason Fenske appear from probation and parole.  Victim also appears.  Court questions victim.  Agents heard on concern with restraining order.  Victim is heard - Requests restraining order be dismissed.  Court calls case 15CV47.  Both parties appear.  Court verifies petitioner would like restraining order dismissed.  She confirms.  Court is heard, dismisses restraining order.  Rules of supervision will be modified to allow for contact as directed by the department.

No appearance from State of Wisconsin; Defendant, Charles A. Kaepernick in court, this is hearing on victim's letter to modify the conditions of supervision; Probation Agent Alicia Gillingham appears via phone; Victim heard; Agent Gillingham heard - no contact until Def. half way done with treatment, then discuss; Def. makes statement; further discussion; Court will allow contact in a legal setting with an attorney present or in courtroom setting; Court will allow phone contact and will allow contact in a therapeutic setting in counseling he's engaged in or they are engaged in; hearing ended (3:20)

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Charles A. Kaepernick
Current: Dodge County Jail, Juneau, WI 53039 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2015)
Prior: N5403 County Road E, Iron Ridge, WI 53035 United States

Defendant Charles A. Kaepernick in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State is Victim Rights compliant. Attorney Mayer indicated that they are prepared to make a plea today, but not to proceed with sentencing as the State has not had sufficient time to review the most recent reports.  State will be requesting a PSI. Defendant will plead to Counts 1 and 2, and all other counts (3-6) and a new referral in 15DD918 are to be read-in.  Court reviewed the CPR and PQWOR and will order the PSI.   As to Count 1, the defendant made a plea of No Contest.  As to Count 2, the defendant made a plea of No Contest.  Ct. found plea(s) given FKVI, accepted plea(s), and found him guilty of the charge(s) in Count 1 and Count 2.  Court found factual basis.  Uncharged offenses to remain uncharged.
Proposed Order modifying terms of Injunction was sent to Court for signature
Status conference on August 3, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Charles A. Kaepernick in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Mayer heard, Atty Sempf heard, there is also a restraining order in place 15CV47, victim is also present in the courtroom, court questions victim, court orders the bond be modified to read that Mr. and Mrs. may have contact by telephone, written correspondence, and in person only if the defendant is still in jail.  Court also modifies those conditions in 15CV47.  If defendant is released from the jail, then the no contact provisions go back into affect.  Atty Mayer will provide an order.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Motion hearing on May 19, 2015 at 12:45 pm.

8:21. Defendant, Charles A. Kaepernick, in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recess.  Recalled at 8:27.   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't

Defendant Charles A. Kaepernick in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond from State. ADA Sempf heard, requesting increase in amount. Atty Mayer heard, requesting remain the same. ADA Sempf heard. Court heard and does not find basis for modification of bond; bond remains as previously ordered. Motion denied.
Motion hearing on February 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
with added condition - Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. All other previous conditons shall remain in effect.

Defendant Charles A. Kaepernick in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prelim is waived and parties are heard on bond; Court head and will modify bond to $20,000 cash and added condition of absolute sobriety and all other conditons shall remain in effect;  Arraignment scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, MDK, dob 4/19/48 or her residence nor be within 1000 feet of her.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:46) Defendant Charles A. Kaepernick in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (not determined yet). Gilbert Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond, requests $250,000 cash w/conditions; Atty. Vollan response; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 2/5/15 at 8:30am in Br. 4 & Review set 2/4/15 at 8:15 in Br. 4; Court sets $250,000 Cash Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, MDK, dob 4/19/48 or her residence nor go within 1000 feet of her.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
